title.narrative: Mexico Forests and Climate Change Project

description.narrative: The PDO is to support rural communities in Mexico to sustainably manage their forests, build social organization, and generate additional income for forest products and services including the reduction of emissions from deforestation and degradation (REDD+)

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Condition of disbursement for component 3.2 | Description :CONAFOR shall maintain several CollaborationAgreements, inter alia: (c) the necessary agreements with the applicable parties to the CONABIO Trust, for the provision oftechnical assistance to Communities and/or Ejidos under Component 3.2 of the Project; | Due Date :23-Apr-2012

Finance Agreement :Condition of disbursement for component 3.2 | Description :CONAFOR shall maintain several CollaborationAgreements, inter alia: (d) an individual agreement with each ATL, whereby the relevant ATL shall agree to provide technicalassistance to ADLs, and Communities and/or Ejidos under Component 3.2 of the Project | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :IBRD and SCF-F Loan Agreement Condition of disbursement for components 2 and 3.3 | Description :CONAFOR shallhire additional staff in the communications, social, procurement and financial management areas. At least one CONAFORstaff will beavailable to work full time as of January 1, 2012 to handle the procurement issues of the Project. | Due Date :30-May-2013

Finance Agreement :IBRD and SCF-FIP Loan Agreements | Description :CONAFOR shall assign an annual budget to CONAFOR's units incharge of social issues and communications to ensure effective implementation of the Indigenous Peoples Planning Framework and theProcess Framework, and the integration of social issues in all of CONAFOR programs supported by the project. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :IBRD and SCF-FIP Loan Agreements | Description :CONAFOR shall enter into additional Collaboration Arrangementswith: (a) CONEVAL in which CONNAFOR shall seek CONEVAL's methodological advice for the design of an impact evaluation strategyunder Component 1.1 of the Project; | Due Date :30-May-2013

Finance Agreement :IBRD and SCF-FIP Loan Agreements | Description :CONAFOR shall enter into additional Collaboration Arrangementswith: (b) CDI in which CONAFOR shall seek CDI's technical and institutional collaboration in the dissemination of information andconsultations with indigenous peoples under the Project | Due Date :30-May-2013

Finance Agreement :IBRD and SCF-FIP Loan Agreements | Description :CONAFOR shall enter into additional Collaboration Arrangementswith: (c) INMUJERES, in which CONAFOR shall seek INMUJEREs advice in the implementation of gender-related aspects of the Project.| Due Date :30-May-2013

Finance Agreement :IBRD and SCF-FIP Loan Agreements | Description :CONAFOR shall enter into agreements with each Community and/orEjido carrying out activities under Components 2 3.3 of the Project. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :IBRD and SCF-FIP Loan Agreements | Description :CONAFOR shall maintain several Collaboration Agreements, interalia: (a) an agreement with SEMARNAT, for the establishment of jointdatabases to share information and experiences regardingmonitoring systems under Component 1.3 of the Project; | Due Date :07-Nov-2011

Finance Agreement :IBRD and SCF-FIP Loan Agreements | Description :CONAFOR shall maintain several Collaboration Agreements, interalia: (b) an agreement with SAGARPA, which shall include, inter alia, their respective responsibilities for the establishment ofjoint databases to share information and experiences regarding monitoring systems under Component 1.3 of the Project; | Due Date:09-Nov-2011
Finance Agreement :IBRD and SCF-FIP Loan Agreements | Description :CONAFOR shall set up (i) a steering committee; (ii) anoperations committee; (ii | Due Date :31-Mar-2012
